result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jamason N Ames

records.addlTxt:
9:04 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Attorney Amy C Scholz in court for Jamason N Ames.  Prosecuting attorney Melissa J. Zilavy in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appears by authorization. Atty. Scholz provides an update; she is still waiting on an offer from the State.  State advises there is an offer and will forward it to Atty. Scholz.  Atty. Scholz requests another further proceedings in about 30-45 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

8:33 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant Jamason N Ames in court.  Attorney Amy C Scholz in court for Jamason N Ames.  Atty. Scholz provides an update, she is requesting another further proceedings in about 30 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty. Amy C. Scholz

Adjustment Number: 22A 032860,
Payable Number: 472882,
Receipt Number: 22R 035731,
Amount: $20.00
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key. Signed by Judge Paul Reilly on 8/11/22

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant may not have contact with Victim A until August 5, 2022 at 12:00 pm once the firearms are turned over to the Sheriff's Department.  Once the firearms are turned over, defendant is not to have any violent contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to use or possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.  Defendant to turn over all his firearms to the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department by August 5, 2022 at 12:00 pm.

01:30 PM Defendant Jamason N Ames in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Defendant states he has about ten firearms at his residence.  The Court will allow the defendant until August 5, 2022 at 12:00 pm to get all firearms together and bring them to the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.  Hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
